# Communication Brief Template

> **Purpose**: Provide a concise structure for stakeholder updates, incident communications, or release announcements.
> Customize each section based on the audience (e.g., executives, engineers, customers).

## Summary
- **Topic**: [Incident, release, or decision]
- **Date / Time**: [YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM TZ]
- **Audience**: [Teams, customers, leadership groups]
- **Author**: [Primary communicator]

## Situation Overview
Describe what happened, why the communication is needed, and the latest status. Include a one-sentence
executive summary that clarifies impact.

## Impact Assessment
| Area | Impacted? | Details |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Customers / Users | [Yes/No] | [Scope, severity, channels affected] |
| Internal Teams | [Yes/No] | [Engineering, support, operations impact] |
| Compliance / Commitments | [Yes/No] | [Any SLA/SLO or regulatory effects] |

## Key Messages
1. **Primary message** – [Core takeaway or decision]
2. **Supporting detail** – [Data point, evidence, or link]
3. **Call to action** – [What recipients must do next]

## Timeline
| Time | Event | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM] | [Milestone] | [Context or owners] |

## Next Steps and Owners
- [Action item] – Owner, due date
- [Action item] – Owner, due date

## Communication Channels
List the channels where this brief will be shared (e.g., email list, incident room, status page) and any
follow-up cadence expectations.

## Attachments / References
- [Link to incident ticket, document, or dashboard]
- [Supporting policy or process reference]

| Version | Date | Author | Notes |
